1.0: And this stumbling block - meaning, so began the discourse on scripture, it is written "this stumbling block [ruin] under your hand" regarding the men of Jerusalem for whom Torah had ceased, and they were asking their friends "you have a mantle, be our ruler, and this ruin should be under your hand", that is to say, these things that are opaque like your mantle, you that are an expert on them, tell us [what to do] and be a ruler. And this stumbling block are the words of Torah, that a person does not have a firm standing on their truth unless he stumbles on them, to teach mistakes and be humiliated by them, and then one pays attention and understands. Under your hand they are - even I stumbled in my teaching and retracted [what I said].
